mainText:
'If you wish to pre-purchase the game, pre-orders open December 13, 2025.
If you don‚Äôt feel comfortable pre-ordering, please don‚Äôt. This is true early access, meaning it‚Äôs still very much unfinished and will be buggy for a while, but you have the team's commitment to make Hytale the game we‚Äôve always wanted it to be.More details are coming soon. Thank you, everyone, for your support. Hytale has been through a long journey, and soon, we will be home.'

'Hytale Early Access
JANUARY 13, 2026'
'I love this game so much. You deserve it.'

With the future of world gen this gets much better. Will show some examples in the next couple days!'

mainText: 'I saw a reddit post saying I broke my promise of end of week, so I made some calls brother'

summary: Simon, re: user pointing out what Simon said to another user
mainText: 'üòÇ'

'Friday 10AM EST on @Hytale for official reveal of the early access release date.

Let me break it to you and reset expectations, the acquisition took just long enough to prevent us from doing a release before Holidays. That‚Äôs why it took us so long to announce the date, we tried to push as hard as we could but legally there is just too much to do and we would be cutting too close to Christmas.

Go make your predictions. See you Friday for reveal!'
'It's already all implemented, yes. We even actually added the proximity chest to the station feature a few weeks ago.'
'We have done a lot of the translation work to plug in crowdin and let community help us out :)'

summary: Simon, re: probability of release date being next week
mainText:
'I think it's essential to be careful here, not jump to conclusions, and not hyperfocus on dates because of the past. Yes, we are going fast, and things are happening every single day, but let's be realistic and stay calm before we lock down any release dates! A lot of it is still in the works. We've had the game on our computers for barely 10 days.

To give some context, we just received the final game files and documents yesterday, and we still need to finish the legal content for the release. You can't launch a game without a ToS/EULA and other related documents, so we are pouring hundreds of thousands of dollars into legal work to expedite this. Given that we want to let players modify our game, it requires some custom work to make sure we get it right. In parallel, we are still awaiting other legal transfers of assets, so we can't announce a release date just yet (no one's fault; it's just the nature of how these things work, and Thanksgiving means some services will be closed). 

I know everyone is excited, but we have to set expectations: it's a lot of work on several fronts, and the leadership team is taking no days off to make sure we don't lose any time on our side. We are on the clock to earn the players' trust and show how quickly we can turn things around. The moment we can securely announce a solid release date, we will.

Keep in mind that the game has never undergone proper testing, so we are finding all sorts of crazy bugs, but none of that matters for release. We have been very clear publicly that we are shipping something unfinished and will continue to do so. With warnings on the website, in-game, and social media, we will be OK with negative criticism.

On top of the game itself, we had to build a new website backend, launcher, auth system, patching, and a lot more in the last few weeks. We've cleaned up a lot of the code and assets, merged hundreds of branches, and refactored the critical parts we wanted to get done on time. The good news is, on that front, we are feeling great about the release. It has been an incredible engineering challenge, to say the least!

We are almost home. I'll give you all a release date as soon as I can. By the end of this week, I'll make a final decision, and by Monday, we'll post the early access release date.'

summary: Blockbench shares tips for pre-emptively making Hytale models
mainText:
'Some tips if you want to make models for Hytale already before the tools release, to make it easier to convert later:

1. Use the Generic format. Models are build from groups, cubes, and quads (flat cubes with only one side). Don't use meshes (including cuboid or plane meshes).
2. Models face south (positive Z)
3. Player and player attachment models are 64x, other models are 32x (pixels per block). It's best to leave the grid snapping and pixel density at default (16) and model at a larger scale, so that 1 pixel on the texture equals 1 unit on the model'

summary: Simon, re: difficulty of making food engaging
mainText: 'Yep you are right'
'Potions can be used for insta or short duration for combat emergencies'

'Right now there is not much fun about cooking in Hytale, we will explore ton of concepts in the coming months while in early access!
Modders will probably give us plenty of ideas!'

'Food can be way more interesting than a simple hunger system.
In the long term we will explore mixing ingredients for food that gives unique buffs, use activity-based meals like a mining stew for faster swings, prep combat meals, feed NPC villages, get quality system tied with bonuses, or build food mastery. Extra food isn‚Äôt wasted when it fuels buffs, NPC exchange, or NPC reputation.

There are tons of ways to avoid hunger mechanics tbh, not saying no hunger ever but I would like to explore some ideas first. 

ATM its a buff mechanic a bit like Valheim. Stam/hp max and regen buff for X time.'
'GG!'
